User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user within the FlightTrackr application.

email.description: The email address of the user.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the user account was created.

definition.description: Stores user data. Access is restricted to the user with the matching userId.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user (same as Firebase Auth UID).

firestore.reasoning:
This design prioritizes simplicity and security for user authentication. It focuses on storing user data in a dedicated collection (`/users/{userId}`) with path-based ownership. This approach is highly secure, as it naturally restricts access to user-specific data. It is very debuggable since the authorization rules will simply validate that the request is authenticated and the `request.auth.uid` matches the `userId` path parameter.

**Authorization Independence:** The design inherently achieves authorization independence because access control is based directly on the `userId` in the path. There are no `get()` calls to other documents required to validate access.

**QAPs Support:** This structure directly supports secure list operations for user-owned data. Security rules can easily restrict listing operations to only allow a user to access their own data based on the `userId`.
